values.comment: Returns the cosine of the input.
values.type: Mapbox.Expression.Expression exprType Basics.Float -> Mapbox.Expression.Expression exprType Basics.Float

values.name: count
values.comment: Gets the length of an array.
values.type: Mapbox.Expression.Expression exprType (Array.Array any) -> Mapbox.Expression.Expression exprType Basics.Float

values.name: defaultCollator
values.comment: Returns a `Collator` with the default locale (which depends on the system running the code), which is not sensitive to case nor diacritic.

values.name: divideBy
values.comment:
Returns the result of floating point division of the second input by the first.

    a |> divideBy b --> a / b
values.type: Mapbox.Expression.Expression exprType Basics.Float -> Mapbox.Expression.Expression exprType Basics.Float -> Mapbox.Expression.Expression exprType Basics.Float

values.name: downcase
values.comment: Returns the input string converted to lowercase. Follows the Unicode Default Case Conversion algorithm and the locale-insensitive case mappings in the Unicode Character Database.
values.type: Mapbox.Expression.Expression exprType String.String -> Mapbox.Expression.Expression exprType String.String

values.name: e
values.comment: Returns the mathematical constant e.

values.name: encode
values.comment: Turns an expression into JSON

values.name: featureState
values.comment: Retrieves a property value from the current feature's state. Returns null if the requested property is not present on the feature's state. A feature's state is not part of the GeoJSON or vector tile data, and must be set programmatically on each feature. Note that `featureState` can only be used with paint properties that support data-driven styling.
values.type: Mapbox.Expression.Expression exprType String.String -> Mapbox.Expression.Expression Mapbox.Expression.DataExpression any

values.name: floor
values.comment: Returns the largest integer that is less than or equal to the input.
values.type: Mapbox.Expression.Expression exprType Basics.Float -> Mapbox.Expression.Expression exprType Basics.Float

values.name: fontScaledBy
values.comment:
Specifies a scaling factor relative to the text-size specified in the root layout properties.

Note: this is indempotent, so calling `str "hi" |> formatted |> fontScaledBy 1.2 |> fontScaledBy 1.2` is equivalent to `str "hi" |> formatted |> fontScaledBy 1.2` rather than `str "hi" |> formatted |> fontScaledBy 1.44`.

values.name: format
values.comment:
Returns formatted text containing annotations for use in mixed-format text-field entries.

    Layer.textField <|
        E.format
            [ E.getProperty (str "name_en")
                |> E.formatted
                |> E.fontScaledBy (float 1.2)
            , E.formatted (str "\n")
            , E.getProperty (str "name")
                |> E.formatted
                |> E.fontScaledBy (float 0.8)
                |> E.withFont (E.strings [ "DIN Offc Pro Medium" ])

values.name: formatted
values.comment: Takes a String Expression and turns it into a FormattedString with default formatting.

values.name: geometryType
values.comment: Gets the feature's geometry type: Point, MultiPoint, LineString, MultiLineString, Polygon, MultiPolygon.

values.name: get
values.comment: Retrieves a property value from an object. Returns null if the requested property is missing.
values.type: Mapbox.Expression.Expression exprType1 String.String -> Mapbox.Expression.Expression exprType2 Mapbox.Expression.Object -> Mapbox.Expression.Expression exprType2 any

values.name: getProperty
values.comment: Retrieves a property value from the current feature's properties. Returns null if the requested property is missing.
values.type: Mapbox.Expression.Expression exprType String.String -> Mapbox.Expression.Expression Mapbox.Expression.DataExpression any

values.name: greaterThan
values.comment: Returns true if the first input is strictly greater than the second, false otherwise.
values.type: Mapbox.Expression.Expression exprType1 comparable -> Mapbox.Expression.Expression exprType2 comparable -> Mapbox.Expression.Expression exprType1 Basics.Bool

values.name: greaterThanOrEqual
values.comment: Returns true if the first input is greater than or equal to the second, false otherwise.
values.type: Mapbox.Expression.Expression exprType1 comparable -> Mapbox.Expression.Expression exprType2 comparable -> Mapbox.Expression.Expression exprType1 Basics.Bool

values.name: greaterThanOrEqualWithCollator
values.type: Mapbox.Expression.Expression exprType1 String.String -> Mapbox.Expression.Expression exprType2 String.String -> Mapbox.Expression.Expression exprType3 Mapbox.Expression.Collator -> Mapbox.Expression.Expression exprType1 Basics.Bool

values.name: greaterThanWithCollator
values.type: Mapbox.Expression.Expression exprType1 String.String -> Mapbox.Expression.Expression exprType2 String.String -> Mapbox.Expression.Expression exprType3 Mapbox.Expression.Collator -> Mapbox.Expression.Expression exprType1 Basics.Bool

values.name: has
values.comment: Tests for the presence of an property value in an object.
values.type: Mapbox.Expression.Expression exprType1 String.String -> Mapbox.Expression.Expression exprType2 Mapbox.Expression.Object -> Mapbox.Expression.Expression exprType2 Basics.Bool

values.name: hasProperty
values.comment: Tests for the presence of an property value in the current feature's properties.
values.type: Mapbox.Expression.Expression exprType String.String -> Mapbox.Expression.Expression Mapbox.Expression.DataExpression Basics.Bool

values.name: heatmapDensity
values.comment: Gets the kernel density estimation of a pixel in a heatmap layer, which is a relative measure of how many data points are crowded around a particular pixel. Can only be used in the `heatmapColor` property.

values.name: id
values.comment: Gets the feature's id, if it has one.

values.name: ifElse
values.comment:
The ternary operator:

    Layer.iconImage <|
      ifElse
        (greaterThan (getProperty (str "size")) (float 30))
        (str "hospital-32")
        (str "clinic-32")
values.type: Mapbox.Expression.Expression exprType1 Basics.Bool -> Mapbox.Expression.Expression exprType2 output -> Mapbox.Expression.Expression exprType3 output -> Mapbox.Expression.Expression exprType1 output

values.name: interpolate
values.comment:
Produces continuous, smooth results by interpolating between pairs of input and output values ("stops"). The output type must be `Float`, `Array Float`, or `Color`.

    zoom
        |> interpolate Linear
            [ ( 5, int 1 )
            , ( 10, int 5 )
            ]
        |> Layer.circleRadius
values.type: Mapbox.Expression.Interpolation -> List.List ( Basics.Float, Mapbox.Expression.Expression exprType2 outputType ) -> Mapbox.Expression.Expression exprType1 Basics.Float -> Mapbox.Expression.Expression exprType1 outputType

values.name: isEqual
values.comment: Returns true if the input values are equal, false otherwise.
values.type: Mapbox.Expression.Expression exprType1 a -> Mapbox.Expression.Expression exprType2 a -> Mapbox.Expression.Expression exprType1 Basics.Bool

values.name: isEqualWithCollator
values.type: Mapbox.Expression.Expression exprType1 String.String -> Mapbox.Expression.Expression exprType2 String.String -> Mapbox.Expression.Expression exprType3 Mapbox.Expression.Collator -> Mapbox.Expression.Expression exprType1 Basics.Bool

values.name: isSupportedScript
values.comment: Returns true if the input string is expected to render legibly. Returns false if the input string contains sections that cannot be rendered without potential loss of meaning (e.g. Indic scripts that require complex text shaping, or right-to-left scripts if the the mapbox-gl-rtl-text plugin is not in use in Mapbox GL JS).
values.type: Mapbox.Expression.Expression exprType String.String -> Mapbox.Expression.Expression exprType Basics.Bool

values.name: length
values.comment: Gets the length of a string.
values.type: Mapbox.Expression.Expression exprType String.String -> Mapbox.Expression.Expression exprType Basics.Float

values.name: lessThan
values.comment: Returns true if the first input is strictly less than the second, false otherwise.
values.type: Mapbox.Expression.Expression exprType1 comparable -> Mapbox.Expression.Expression exprType2 comparable -> Mapbox.Expression.Expression exprType1 Basics.Bool

values.name: lessThanOrEqual
values.comment: Returns true if the first input is less than or equal to the second, false otherwise.
values.type: Mapbox.Expression.Expression exprType1 comparable -> Mapbox.Expression.Expression exprType2 comparable -> Mapbox.Expression.Expression exprType1 Basics.Bool

values.name: lessThanOrEqualWithCollator
values.type: Mapbox.Expression.Expression exprType1 String.String -> Mapbox.Expression.Expression exprType2 String.String -> Mapbox.Expression.Expression exprType3 Mapbox.Expression.Collator -> Mapbox.Expression.Expression exprType1 Basics.Bool

values.name: lessThanWithCollator
values.type: Mapbox.Expression.Expression exprType1 String.String -> Mapbox.Expression.Expression exprType2 String.String -> Mapbox.Expression.Expression exprType3 Mapbox.Expression.Collator -> Mapbox.Expression.Expression exprType1 Basics.Bool

values.name: lineCapButt
values.comment: A cap with a squared-off end which is drawn to the exact endpoint of the line.

values.name: lineCapRound
values.comment: A cap with a rounded end which is drawn beyond the endpoint of the line at a radius of one-half of the line's width and centered on the endpoint of the line.

values.name: lineCapSquare
values.comment: A cap with a squared-off end which is drawn beyond the endpoint of the line at a distance of one-half of the line's width.

values.name: lineJoinBevel
values.comment: A join with a squared-off end which is drawn beyond the endpoint of the line at a distance of one-half of the line's width.

values.name: lineJoinMiter
values.comment: A join with a sharp, angled corner which is drawn with the outer sides beyond the endpoint of the path until they meet.

values.name: lineJoinRound
values.comment: A join with a rounded end which is drawn beyond the endpoint of the line at a radius of one-half of the line's width and centered on the endpoint of the line.

values.name: lineProgress
values.comment: Gets the progress along a gradient line. Can only be used in the `lineGradient` property.

values.name: ln
values.comment: Returns the natural logarithm of the input.
values.type: Mapbox.Expression.Expression exprType Basics.Float -> Mapbox.Expression.Expression exprType Basics.Float

values.name: ln2
values.comment: Returns mathematical constant ln(2).

values.name: log10
values.comment: Returns the base-ten logarithm of the input.
values.type: Mapbox.Expression.Expression exprType Basics.Float -> Mapbox.Expression.Expression exprType Basics.Float

values.name: log2
values.comment: Returns the base-two logarithm of the input.
values.type: Mapbox.Expression.Expression exprType Basics.Float -> Mapbox.Expression.Expression exprType Basics.Float

values.name: makeRGBAColor
values.comment: Creates a color value from red, green, blue components, which must range between 0 and 255, and an alpha component which must range between 0 and 1. If any component is out of range, the expression is an error.
values.type: Mapbox.Expression.Expression exprType Basics.Float -> Mapbox.Expression.Expression exprType Basics.Float -> Mapbox.Expression.Expression exprType Basics.Float -> Mapbox.Expression.Expression exprType Basics.Float -> Mapbox.Expression.Expression exprType Mapbox.Expression.Color

values.name: makeRGBColor
values.comment: Creates a color value from red, green, and blue components, which must range between 0 and 255, and an alpha component of 1. If any component is out of range, the expression is an error.
values.type: Mapbox.Expression.Expression exprType Basics.Float -> Mapbox.Expression.Expression exprType Basics.Float -> Mapbox.Expression.Expression exprType Basics.Float -> Mapbox.Expression.Expression exprType Mapbox.Expression.Color

values.name: matchesFloat
values.comment:
Selects the output whose label value matches the input value, or the fallback value if no match is found.

    getProperty (str "size")
      |> matchesFloat
          [ (1, str "icon-hospital")
          , (2, str "icon-medical")
          ]
          (str "icon-generic") -- fallback value
      |> Layer.iconImage
values.type: List.List ( Basics.Float, Mapbox.Expression.Expression exprType2 output ) -> Mapbox.Expression.Expression exprType1 output -> Mapbox.Expression.Expression exprType3 Basics.Float -> Mapbox.Expression.Expression exprType3 output

values.name: matchesStr
values.comment:
Selects the output whose label value matches the input value, or the fallback value if no match is found.

    getProperty (str "type")
      |> matchesStr
          [ ("hospital", str "icon-hospital")
          , ("clinic", str "icon-medical")
          ]
          (str "icon-generic") -- fallback value
      |> Layer.iconImage
values.type: List.List ( String.String, Mapbox.Expression.Expression exprType2 output ) -> Mapbox.Expression.Expression exprType1 output -> Mapbox.Expression.Expression exprType3 String.String -> Mapbox.Expression.Expression exprType3 output

values.name: minus
values.comment:
Returns the result of subtracting the first input from the second.

    a |> minus b --> a - b
values.type: Mapbox.Expression.Expression exprType Basics.Float -> Mapbox.Expression.Expression exprType Basics.Float -> Mapbox.Expression.Expression exprType Basics.Float

values.name: modBy
values.comment:
Returns the remainder after integer division of the second input by the first.

    a |> modBy b --> a % b
values.type: Mapbox.Expression.Expression exprType Basics.Float -> Mapbox.Expression.Expression exprType Basics.Float -> Mapbox.Expression.Expression exprType Basics.Float

values.name: multiply
values.comment: Returns the product of the inputs.
values.type: Mapbox.Expression.Expression exprType Basics.Float -> Mapbox.Expression.Expression exprType Basics.Float -> Mapbox.Expression.Expression exprType Basics.Float

values.name: not
values.comment: Logical negation. Returns true if the input is false, and false if the input is true.
values.type: Mapbox.Expression.Expression exprType Basics.Bool -> Mapbox.Expression.Expression exprType Basics.Bool

values.name: notEqual
values.comment: Returns true if the input values are not equal, false otherwise.
values.type: Mapbox.Expression.Expression exprType1 a -> Mapbox.Expression.Expression exprType2 a -> Mapbox.Expression.Expression exprType1 Basics.Bool

values.name: notEqualWithCollator
values.type: Mapbox.Expression.Expression exprType1 String.String -> Mapbox.Expression.Expression exprType2 String.String -> Mapbox.Expression.Expression exprType3 Mapbox.Expression.Collator -> Mapbox.Expression.Expression exprType1 Basics.Bool

values.name: object
values.comment:
Takes a list of key value pairs. The values are JSON Values,
therefore allowing for mixed types.
values.type: List.List ( String.String, Json.Encode.Value ) -> Mapbox.Expression.Expression exprType Mapbox.Expression.Object

values.name: orderSource
values.comment: Symbols will be rendered in the same order as the source data with no sorting applied.

values.name: orderViewportY
values.comment: Symbols will be sorted by their y-position relative to the viewport.

values.name: plus
values.comment: Returns the sum of the inputs.
values.type: Mapbox.Expression.Expression exprType Basics.Float -> Mapbox.Expression.Expression exprType Basics.Float -> Mapbox.Expression.Expression exprType Basics.Float

values.name: properties
values.comment: Gets the feature properties object. Note that in some cases, it may be more efficient to use `getProperty (str "property-name")` directly.

values.name: raiseBy
values.comment:
Returns the result of raising the second input to the power specified by the first.

    a |> raiseBy b --> a ^ b
values.type: Mapbox.Expression.Expression exprType Basics.Float -> Mapbox.Expression.Expression exprType Basics.Float -> Mapbox.Expression.Expression exprType Basics.Float

values.name: rasterResamplingLinear
values.comment: (Bi)linear filtering interpolates pixel values using the weighted average of the four closest original source pixels creating a smooth but blurry look when overscaled.

values.name: rasterResamplingNearest
values.comment: Nearest neighbor filtering interpolates pixel values using the nearest original source pixel creating a sharp but pixelated look when overscaled.

values.name: resolvedLocale
values.comment: Returns the IETF language tag of the locale being used by the provided collator. This can be used to determine the default system locale, or to determine if a requested locale was successfully loaded.
values.type: Mapbox.Expression.Expression exprType Mapbox.Expression.Collator -> Mapbox.Expression.Expression exprType String.String

values.name: rgba
values.type: Basics.Float -> Basics.Float -> Basics.Float -> Basics.Float -> Mapbox.Expression.Expression exprType Mapbox.Expression.Color

values.name: rgbaChannels
values.comment: Returns a four-element array containing the input color's red, green, blue, and alpha components, in that order.
values.type: Mapbox.Expression.Expression exprType Mapbox.Expression.Color -> Mapbox.Expression.Expression exprType (Array.Array Basics.Float)

values.name: round
values.comment: Rounds the input to the nearest integer. Halfway values are rounded away from zero. For example, `round  (float -1.5)` evaluates to -2.
values.type: Mapbox.Expression.Expression exprType Basics.Float -> Mapbox.Expression.Expression exprType Basics.Float

values.name: sin
values.comment: Returns the sine of the input.
values.type: Mapbox.Expression.Expression exprType Basics.Float -> Mapbox.Expression.Expression exprType Basics.Float

values.name: sqrt
values.comment: Returns the square root of the input.
values.type: Mapbox.Expression.Expression exprType Basics.Float -> Mapbox.Expression.Expression exprType Basics.Float

values.name: step
values.comment:
Produces discrete, stepped results by evaluating a piecewise-constant function defined by pairs of input and output values ("stops"). Stop inputs must be Floats in strictly ascending order. Returns the output value of the stop just less than the input, or the first input if the input is less than the first stop.

    zoom
        |> step (int 1)
            [ ( 5, int 3 )
            , ( 10, int 5 )
            ]
        |> Layer.circleRadius
values.type: Mapbox.Expression.Expression exprType1 output -> List.List ( Basics.Float, Mapbox.Expression.Expression exprType1 output ) -> Mapbox.Expression.Expression exprType2 Basics.Float -> Mapbox.Expression.Expression exprType2 output

values.name: symbolPlacementLine
values.comment: The label is placed along the line of the geometry. Can only be used on LineString and Polygon geometries.

values.name: symbolPlacementLineCenter
values.comment: The label is placed at the center of the line of the geometry. Can only be used on LineString and Polygon geometries. Note that a single feature in a vector tile may contain multiple line geometries.

values.name: symbolPlacementPoint
values.comment: The label is placed at the point where the geometry is located.

values.name: tan
values.comment: Returns the tangent of the input.
values.type: Mapbox.Expression.Expression exprType Basics.Float -> Mapbox.Expression.Expression exprType Basics.Float

values.name: textFitBoth
values.comment: The icon is scaled in both x- and y-dimensions.

values.name: textFitHeight
values.comment: The icon is scaled in the y-dimension to fit the height of the text.

values.name: textFitNone
values.comment: The icon is displayed at its intrinsic aspect ratio.

values.name: textFitWidth
values.comment: The icon is scaled in the x-dimension to fit the width of the text.

values.name: textJustifyCenter
values.comment: The text is centered.

values.name: textJustifyLeft
values.comment: The text is aligned to the left.

values.name: textJustifyRight
values.comment: The text is aligned to the right.

values.name: textTransformLowercase
values.comment: Forces all letters to be displayed in lowercase.

values.name: textTransformNone
values.comment: The text is not altered.

values.name: textTransformUppercase
values.comment: Forces all letters to be displayed in uppercase.

values.name: toBool
values.comment: Converts the input value to a boolean. The result is false when then input is an empty string, 0, false, null, or NaN; otherwise it is true.
values.type: Mapbox.Expression.Expression exprType any -> Mapbox.Expression.Expression exprType Basics.Bool

values.name: toColor
values.comment:
Converts the input value to a color. If it can't be converted, the falback value will be used.

    input
      |> toColor (rgba 0 0 0 1) -- fallback color
values.type: Mapbox.Expression.Expression exprType2 Mapbox.Expression.Color -> Mapbox.Expression.Expression exprType any -> Mapbox.Expression.Expression exprType Mapbox.Expression.Color

values.name: toFloat
values.comment:
Converts the input value to a number, if possible. If the input is null or false, the result is 0. If the input is true, the result is 1. If the input is a string, it is converted to a number as specified by the ["ToNumber Applied to the String Type" algorithm of the ECMAScript Language Specification](https://tc39.github.io/ecma262/#sec-tonumber-applied-to-the-string-type). If this fails, the fallback value is used.

    input
      |> toFloat 0 -- fallback
values.type: Basics.Float -> Mapbox.Expression.Expression exprType any -> Mapbox.Expression.Expression exprType Basics.Float

values.name: toString
values.comment: Converts the input value to a string. If the input is `null`, the result is `""`. If the input is a boolean, the result is `"true"` or `"false"`. If the input is a number, it is converted to a string as specified by the ["NumberToString" algorithm](https://tc39.github.io/ecma262/#sec-tostring-applied-to-the-number-type) of the ECMAScript Language Specification. If the input is a color, it is converted to a string of the form `"rgba(r,g,b,a)"`, where r, g, and b are numerals ranging from 0 to 255, and a ranges from 0 to 1. Otherwise, the input is converted to a string in the format specified by the [`JSON.stringify`](https://tc39.github.io/ecma262/#sec-json.stringify) function of the ECMAScript Language Specification.
values.type: Mapbox.Expression.Expression exprType any -> Mapbox.Expression.Expression exprType String.String

values.name: typeof
values.comment: Returns a string describing the type of the given value.
values.type: Mapbox.Expression.Expression exprType any -> Mapbox.Expression.Expression exprType String.String

values.name: upcase
values.comment: Returns the input string converted to uppercase. Follows the Unicode Default Case Conversion algorithm and the locale-insensitive case mappings in the Unicode Character Database.
values.type: Mapbox.Expression.Expression exprType String.String -> Mapbox.Expression.Expression exprType String.String

values.name: withFont
values.comment: Overrides the font specified by the root layout properties.

values.name: zoom
values.comment: Gets the current zoom level. Note that in style layout and paint properties, `zoom` may only appear as the input to a top-level `step` or `interpolate` expression.

name: Mapbox.Layer

unions.name: Layer
unions.comment: Represents a layer.

aliases.name: SourceId
aliases.comment: All layers (except background layers) need a source

values.name: background
values.comment: The background color or pattern of the map.

values.name: backgroundColor
values.comment: The color with which the background will be drawn. Paint property. Defaults to `#000000`. Disabled by `backgroundPattern`.

values.name: backgroundOpacity
values.comment:
The opacity at which the background will be drawn. Paint property.

Should be between `0` and `1` inclusive. Defaults to `1`.

values.name: backgroundPattern
values.comment: Name of image in sprite to use for drawing an image background. For seamless patterns, image width and height must be a factor of two (2, 4, 8, ..., 512). Note that zoom-dependent expressions will be evaluated only at integer zoom levels. Paint property.

values.name: circle
values.comment: A filled circle.

values.name: circleBlur
values.comment: Amount to blur the circle. 1 blurs the circle such that only the centerpoint is full opacity. Paint property. Defaults to `0`.

values.name: circleColor
values.comment: The fill color of the circle. Paint property. Defaults to `#000000`.

values.name: circleOpacity
values.comment:
The opacity at which the circle will be drawn. Paint property.

Should be between `0` and `1` inclusive. Defaults to `1`.

values.name: circlePitchAlignment
values.comment:
Orientation of circle when map is pitched. Paint property. Defaults to `anchorViewport`.

  - `anchorMap`: The circle is aligned to the plane of the map.
  - `anchorViewport`: The circle is aligned to the plane of the viewport.

values.name: circlePitchScale
values.comment:
Controls the scaling behavior of the circle when the map is pitched. Paint property. Defaults to `anchorMap`.

  - `anchorMap`: Circles are scaled according to their apparent distance to the camera.
  - `anchorViewport`: Circles are not scaled.

values.name: circleRadius
values.comment:
Circle radius. Paint property.

Should be greater than or equal to `0`.
Units in pixels. Defaults to `5`.

values.name: circleStrokeColor
values.comment: The stroke color of the circle. Paint property. Defaults to `#000000`.

values.name: circleStrokeOpacity
values.comment:
The opacity of the circle's stroke. Paint property.

Should be between `0` and `1` inclusive. Defaults to `1`.

values.name: circleStrokeWidth
values.comment:
The width of the circle's stroke. Strokes are placed outside of the `circleRadius`. Paint property.

Should be greater than or equal to `0`.
Units in pixels. Defaults to `0`.

values.name: circleTranslate
values.comment:
The geometry's offset. Values are [x, y] where negatives indicate left and up, respectively. Paint property.
Units in pixels. Defaults to `0,0`.

values.name: circleTranslateAnchor
values.comment:
Controls the frame of reference for `circleTranslate`. Paint property. Defaults to `anchorMap`. Requires `circleTranslate`.

  - `anchorMap`: The circle is translated relative to the map.
  - `anchorViewport`: The circle is translated relative to the viewport.

values.name: encode
values.comment: Turns a layer into JSON

values.name: fill
values.comment: A filled polygon with an optional stroked border.

values.name: fillAntialias
values.comment: Whether or not the fill should be antialiased. Paint property. Defaults to `true`.

values.name: fillColor
values.comment: The color of the filled part of this layer. This color can be specified as `rgba` with an alpha component and the color's opacity will not affect the opacity of the 1px stroke, if it is used. Paint property. Defaults to `#000000`. Disabled by `fillPattern`.

values.name: fillExtrusion
values.comment: An extruded (3D) polygon.

values.name: fillExtrusionBase
values.comment:
The height with which to extrude the base of this layer. Must be less than or equal to `fillExtrusionHeight`. Paint property.

Should be greater than or equal to `0`.
Units in meters. Defaults to `0`. Requires `fillExtrusionHeight`.

values.name: fillExtrusionColor
values.comment: The base color of the extruded fill. The extrusion's surfaces will be shaded differently based on this color in combination with the root `light` settings. If this color is specified as `rgba` with an alpha component, the alpha component will be ignored; use `fillExtrusionOpacity` to set layer opacity. Paint property. Defaults to `#000000`. Disabled by `fillExtrusionPattern`.

values.name: fillExtrusionHeight
values.comment:
The height with which to extrude this layer. Paint property.

Should be greater than or equal to `0`.
Units in meters. Defaults to `0`.

values.name: fillExtrusionOpacity
values.comment:
The opacity of the entire fill extrusion layer. This is rendered on a per-layer, not per-feature, basis, and data-driven styling is not available. Paint property.

Should be between `0` and `1` inclusive. Defaults to `1`.

values.name: fillExtrusionPattern
values.comment: Name of image in sprite to use for drawing images on extruded fills. For seamless patterns, image width and height must be a factor of two (2, 4, 8, ..., 512). Note that zoom-dependent expressions will be evaluated only at integer zoom levels. Paint property.

values.name: fillExtrusionTranslate
values.comment:
The geometry's offset. Values are [x, y] where negatives indicate left and up (on the flat plane), respectively. Paint property.
Units in pixels. Defaults to `0,0`.

values.name: fillExtrusionTranslateAnchor
values.comment:
Controls the frame of reference for `fillExtrusionTranslate`. Paint property. Defaults to `anchorMap`. Requires `fillExtrusionTranslate`.

  - `anchorMap`: The fill extrusion is translated relative to the map.
  - `anchorViewport`: The fill extrusion is translated relative to the viewport.

values.name: fillExtrusionVerticalGradient
values.comment: Whether to apply a vertical gradient to the sides of a fill-extrusion layer. If true, sides will be shaded slightly darker farther down. Paint property. Defaults to `true`.

values.name: fillOpacity
values.comment:
The opacity of the entire fill layer. In contrast to the `fillColor`, this value will also affect the 1px stroke around the fill, if the stroke is used. Paint property.

Should be between `0` and `1` inclusive. Defaults to `1`.

values.name: fillOutlineColor
values.comment: The outline color of the fill. Matches the value of `fillColor` if unspecified. Paint property. Disabled by `fillPattern`. Requires `fillAntialias` to be `true`.

values.name: fillPattern
values.comment: Name of image in sprite to use for drawing image fills. For seamless patterns, image width and height must be a factor of two (2, 4, 8, ..., 512). Note that zoom-dependent expressions will be evaluated only at integer zoom levels. Paint property.

values.name: fillTranslate
values.comment:
The geometry's offset. Values are [x, y] where negatives indicate left and up, respectively. Paint property.
Units in pixels. Defaults to `0,0`.

values.name: fillTranslateAnchor
values.comment:
Controls the frame of reference for `fillTranslate`. Paint property. Defaults to `anchorMap`. Requires `fillTranslate`.

  - `anchorMap`: The fill is translated relative to the map.
  - `anchorViewport`: The fill is translated relative to the viewport.

values.name: filter
values.comment: A expression specifying conditions on source features. Only features that match the filter are displayed.

values.name: heatmap
values.comment: A heatmap.

values.name: heatmapColor
values.comment:
Defines the color of each pixel based on its density value in a heatmap. The value should be an Expression that uses `heatmapDensity` as input. Defaults to:

      E.heatmapDensity
      |> E.interpolate E.Linear
        [ (0.0, rgba 0 0 255 0)
        , (0.1, rgba 65 105 225 1)
        , (0.3, rgba 0 255 255 1)
        , (0.5, rgba 0 255 0 1)
        , (0.7, rgba 255 255 0 1)
        , (1.0, rgba 255 0 0 1)] Paint property.

values.name: heatmapIntensity
values.comment:
Similar to `heatmapWeight` but controls the intensity of the heatmap globally. Primarily used for adjusting the heatmap based on zoom level. Paint property.

Should be greater than or equal to `0`. Defaults to `1`.

values.name: heatmapOpacity
values.comment:
The global opacity at which the heatmap layer will be drawn. Paint property.

Should be between `0` and `1` inclusive. Defaults to `1`.

values.name: heatmapRadius
values.comment:
Radius of influence of one heatmap point in pixels. Increasing the value makes the heatmap smoother, but less detailed. Paint property.

Should be greater than or equal to `1`.
Units in pixels. Defaults to `30`.

values.name: heatmapWeight
values.comment:
A measure of how much an individual point contributes to the heatmap. A value of 10 would be equivalent to having 10 points of weight 1 in the same spot. Especially useful when combined with clustering. Paint property.

Should be greater than or equal to `0`. Defaults to `1`.

values.name: hillshade
values.comment: Client-side hillshading visualization based on DEM data. Currently, the implementation only supports Mapbox Terrain RGB and Mapzen Terrarium tiles.

values.name: hillshadeAccentColor
values.comment: The shading color used to accentuate rugged terrain like sharp cliffs and gorges. Paint property. Defaults to `#000000`.

values.name: hillshadeExaggeration
values.comment:
Intensity of the hillshade Paint property.

Should be between `0` and `1` inclusive. Defaults to `0.5`.

values.name: hillshadeHighlightColor
values.comment: The shading color of areas that faces towards the light source. Paint property. Defaults to `#FFFFFF`.

values.name: hillshadeIlluminationAnchor
values.comment:
Direction of light source when map is rotated. Paint property. Defaults to `anchorViewport`.

  - `anchorMap`: The hillshade illumination is relative to the north direction.
  - `anchorViewport`: The hillshade illumination is relative to the top of the viewport.

values.name: hillshadeIlluminationDirection
values.comment:
The direction of the light source used to generate the hillshading with 0 as the top of the viewport if `hillshadeIlluminationAnchor` is set to `anchorViewport` and due north if `hillshadeIlluminationAnchor` is set to `anchorMap`. Paint property.

Should be between `0` and `359` inclusive. Defaults to `335`.

values.name: hillshadeShadowColor
values.comment: The shading color of areas that face away from the light source. Paint property. Defaults to `#000000`.

values.name: iconAllowOverlap
values.comment: If true, the icon will be visible even if it collides with other previously drawn symbols. Layout property. Defaults to `false`. Requires `iconImage`.

values.name: iconAnchor
values.comment: Part of the icon placed closest to the anchor. Layout property. Defaults to `positionCenter`. Requires `iconImage`.

values.name: iconColor
values.comment: The color of the icon. This can only be used with sdf icons. Paint property. Defaults to `#000000`. Requires `iconImage`.

values.name: iconHaloBlur
values.comment:
Fade out the halo towards the outside. Paint property.

Should be greater than or equal to `0`.
Units in pixels. Defaults to `0`. Requires `iconImage`.

values.name: iconHaloColor
values.comment: The color of the icon's halo. Icon halos can only be used with SDF icons. Paint property. Defaults to `rgba 0 0 0 0`. Requires `iconImage`.

values.name: iconHaloWidth
values.comment:
Distance of halo to the icon outline. Paint property.

Should be greater than or equal to `0`.
Units in pixels. Defaults to `0`. Requires `iconImage`.

values.name: iconIgnorePlacement
values.comment: If true, other symbols can be visible even if they collide with the icon. Layout property. Defaults to `false`. Requires `iconImage`.

values.name: iconImage
values.comment: Name of image in sprite to use for drawing an image background. Layout property.

values.name: iconKeepUpright
values.comment: If true, the icon may be flipped to prevent it from being rendered upside-down. Layout property. Defaults to `false`. Requires `iconImage`. Requires `iconRotationAlignment` to be `map`. Requires `symbolPlacement` to be `symbolPlacementLine`, or `symbolPlacementLineCenter`.

values.name: iconOffset
values.comment: Offset distance of icon from its anchor. Positive values indicate right and down, while negative values indicate left and up. Each component is multiplied by the value of `iconSize` to obtain the final offset in pixels. When combined with `iconRotate` the offset will be as if the rotated direction was up. Layout property. Defaults to `0,0`. Requires `iconImage`.

values.name: iconOpacity
values.comment:
The opacity at which the icon will be drawn. Paint property.

Should be between `0` and `1` inclusive. Defaults to `1`. Requires `iconImage`.

values.name: iconOptional
values.comment: If true, text will display without their corresponding icons when the icon collides with other symbols and the text does not. Layout property. Defaults to `false`. Requires `iconImage`. Requires `textField`.

values.name: iconPadding
values.comment:
Size of the additional area around the icon bounding box used for detecting symbol collisions. Layout property.

Should be greater than or equal to `0`.
Units in pixels. Defaults to `2`. Requires `iconImage`.

values.name: iconPitchAlignment
values.comment:
Orientation of icon when map is pitched. Layout property. Defaults to `anchorAuto`. Requires `iconImage`.

  - `anchorMap`: The icon is aligned to the plane of the map.
  - `anchorViewport`: The icon is aligned to the plane of the viewport.
  - `anchorAuto`: Automatically matches the value of `iconRotationAlignment`.

values.name: iconRotate
values.comment:
Rotates the icon clockwise. Layout property.
Units in degrees. Defaults to `0`. Requires `iconImage`.

values.name: iconRotationAlignment
values.comment:
In combination with `symbolPlacement`, determines the rotation behavior of icons. Layout property. Defaults to `anchorAuto`. Requires `iconImage`.

  - `anchorMap`: When `symbolPlacement` is set to `symbolPlacementPoint`, aligns icons east-west. When `symbolPlacement` is set to `symbolPlacementLine` or `symbolPlacementLineCenter`, aligns icon x-axes with the line.
  - `anchorViewport`: Produces icons whose x-axes are aligned with the x-axis of the viewport, regardless of the value of `symbolPlacement`.
  - `anchorAuto`: When `symbolPlacement` is set to `symbolPlacementPoint`, this is equivalent to `anchorViewport`. When `symbolPlacement` is set to `symbolPlacementLine` or `symbolPlacementLineCenter`, this is equivalent to `anchorMap`.

values.name: iconSize
values.comment:
Scales the original size of the icon by the provided factor. The new pixel size of the image will be the original pixel size multiplied by `iconSize`. 1 is the original size; 3 triples the size of the image. Layout property.

Should be greater than or equal to `0`.
Units in factor of the original icon size. Defaults to `1`. Requires `iconImage`.

values.name: iconTextFit
values.comment: Scales the icon to fit around the associated text. Layout property. Defaults to `textFitNone`. Requires `iconImage`. Requires `textField`.

values.name: iconTextFitPadding
values.comment:
Size of the additional area added to dimensions determined by `iconTextFit`, in clockwise order: top, right, bottom, left. Layout property.
Units in pixels. Defaults to `0,0,0,0`. Requires `iconImage`. Requires `textField`. Requires `iconTextFit` to be `textFitBoth`, or `textFitWidth`, or `textFitHeight`.

values.name: iconTranslate
values.comment:
Distance that the icon's anchor is moved from its original placement. Positive values indicate right and down, while negative values indicate left and up. Paint property.
Units in pixels. Defaults to `0,0`. Requires `iconImage`.

values.name: iconTranslateAnchor
values.comment:
Controls the frame of reference for `iconTranslate`. Paint property. Defaults to `anchorMap`. Requires `iconImage`. Requires `iconTranslate`.

  - `anchorMap`: Icons are translated relative to the map.
  - `anchorViewport`: Icons are translated relative to the viewport.

values.name: line
values.comment: A stroked line.

values.name: lineBlur
values.comment:
Blur applied to the line, in pixels. Paint property.

Should be greater than or equal to `0`.
Units in pixels. Defaults to `0`.

values.name: lineCap
values.comment: The display of line endings. Layout property. Defaults to `lineCapButt`.

values.name: lineColor
values.comment: The color with which the line will be drawn. Paint property. Defaults to `#000000`. Disabled by `linePattern`.

values.name: lineDasharray
values.comment:
Specifies the lengths of the alternating dashes and gaps that form the dash pattern. The lengths are later scaled by the line width. To convert a dash length to pixels, multiply the length by the current line width. Note that GeoJSON sources with `lineMetrics: true` specified won't render dashed lines to the expected scale. Also note that zoom-dependent expressions will be evaluated only at integer zoom levels. Paint property.

Should be greater than or equal to `0`.
Units in line widths. Disabled by `linePattern`.

values.name: lineGapWidth
values.comment:
Draws a line casing outside of a line's actual path. Value indicates the width of the inner gap. Paint property.

Should be greater than or equal to `0`.
Units in pixels. Defaults to `0`.

values.name: lineGradient
values.comment: Defines a gradient with which to color a line feature. Can only be used with GeoJSON sources that specify `"lineMetrics": true`. Paint property. Disabled by `lineDasharray`. Disabled by `linePattern`. Requires `source` to be `geojson`.

values.name: lineJoin
values.comment: The display of lines when joining. Layout property. Defaults to `lineJoinMiter`.

values.name: lineMiterLimit
values.comment: Used to automatically convert miter joins to bevel joins for sharp angles. Layout property. Defaults to `2`. Requires `lineJoin` to be `miter`.

values.name: lineOffset
values.comment:
The line's offset. For linear features, a positive value offsets the line to the right, relative to the direction of the line, and a negative value to the left. For polygon features, a positive value results in an inset, and a negative value results in an outset. Paint property.
Units in pixels. Defaults to `0`.

values.name: lineOpacity
values.comment:
The opacity at which the line will be drawn. Paint property.

Should be between `0` and `1` inclusive. Defaults to `1`.

values.name: linePattern
values.comment: Name of image in sprite to use for drawing image lines. For seamless patterns, image width must be a factor of two (2, 4, 8, ..., 512). Note that zoom-dependent expressions will be evaluated only at integer zoom levels. Paint property.

values.name: lineRoundLimit
values.comment: Used to automatically convert round joins to miter joins for shallow angles. Layout property. Defaults to `1.05`. Requires `lineJoin` to be `round`.

values.name: lineTranslate
values.comment:
The geometry's offset. Values are [x, y] where negatives indicate left and up, respectively. Paint property.
Units in pixels. Defaults to `0,0`.

values.name: lineTranslateAnchor
values.comment:
Controls the frame of reference for `lineTranslate`. Paint property. Defaults to `anchorMap`. Requires `lineTranslate`.

  - `anchorMap`: The line is translated relative to the map.
  - `anchorViewport`: The line is translated relative to the viewport.

values.name: lineWidth
values.comment:
Stroke thickness. Paint property.

Should be greater than or equal to `0`.
Units in pixels. Defaults to `1`.

values.name: maxzoom
values.comment: The maximum zoom level for the layer. At zoom levels equal to or greater than the maxzoom, the layer will be hidden. A number between 0 and 24 inclusive.

values.name: metadata
values.comment: Arbitrary properties useful to track with the layer, but do not influence rendering. Properties should be prefixed to avoid collisions, like 'mapbox:'.

values.name: minzoom
values.comment: The minimum zoom level for the layer. At zoom levels less than the minzoom, the layer will be hidden. A number between 0 and 24 inclusive.

values.name: raster
values.comment: Raster map textures such as satellite imagery.

values.name: rasterBrightnessMax
values.comment:
Increase or reduce the brightness of the image. The value is the maximum brightness. Paint property.

Should be between `0` and `1` inclusive. Defaults to `1`.

values.name: rasterBrightnessMin
values.comment:
Increase or reduce the brightness of the image. The value is the minimum brightness. Paint property.

Should be between `0` and `1` inclusive. Defaults to `0`.

values.name: rasterContrast
values.comment:
Increase or reduce the contrast of the image. Paint property.

Should be between `-1` and `1` inclusive. Defaults to `0`.

values.name: rasterFadeDuration
values.comment:
Fade duration when a new tile is added. Paint property.

Should be greater than or equal to `0`.
Units in milliseconds. Defaults to `300`.

values.name: rasterHueRotate
values.comment:
Rotates hues around the color wheel. Paint property.
Units in degrees. Defaults to `0`.

values.name: rasterOpacity
values.comment:
The opacity at which the image will be drawn. Paint property.

Should be between `0` and `1` inclusive. Defaults to `1`.

values.name: rasterResampling
values.comment: The resampling/interpolation method to use for overscaling, also known as texture magnification filter Paint property. Defaults to `rasterResamplingLinear`.

values.name: rasterSaturation
values.comment:
Increase or reduce the saturation of the image. Paint property.

Should be between `-1` and `1` inclusive. Defaults to `0`.

values.name: sourceLayer
values.comment: Layer to use from a vector tile source. Required for vector tile sources; prohibited for all other source types, including GeoJSON sources.

values.name: symbol
values.comment: An icon or a text label.

values.name: symbolAvoidEdges
values.comment: If true, the symbols will not cross tile edges to avoid mutual collisions. Recommended in layers that don't have enough padding in the vector tile to prevent collisions, or if it is a point symbol layer placed after a line symbol layer. Layout property. Defaults to `false`.

values.name: symbolPlacement
values.comment: Label placement relative to its geometry. Layout property. Defaults to `symbolPlacementPoint`.

values.name: symbolSpacing
values.comment:
Distance between two symbol anchors. Layout property.

Should be greater than or equal to `1`.
Units in pixels. Defaults to `250`. Requires `symbolPlacement` to be `line`.

values.name: symbolZOrder
values.comment: Controls the order in which overlapping symbols in the same layer are rendered Layout property. Defaults to `orderViewportY`.

values.name: textAllowOverlap
values.comment: If true, the text will be visible even if it collides with other previously drawn symbols. Layout property. Defaults to `false`. Requires `textField`.

values.name: textAnchor
values.comment: Part of the text placed closest to the anchor. Layout property. Defaults to `positionCenter`. Requires `textField`.

values.name: textColor
values.comment: The color with which the text will be drawn. Paint property. Defaults to `#000000`. Requires `textField`.

values.name: textField
values.comment: Value to use for a text label. Layout property. Defaults to ``.

values.name: textFont
values.comment: Font stack to use for displaying text. Layout property. Requires `textField`.

values.name: textHaloBlur
values.comment:
The halo's fadeout distance towards the outside. Paint property.

Should be greater than or equal to `0`.
Units in pixels. Defaults to `0`. Requires `textField`.

values.name: textHaloColor
values.comment: The color of the text's halo, which helps it stand out from backgrounds. Paint property. Defaults to `rgba 0 0 0 0`. Requires `textField`.

values.name: textHaloWidth
values.comment:
Distance of halo to the font outline. Max text halo width is 1/4 of the font-size. Paint property.

Should be greater than or equal to `0`.
Units in pixels. Defaults to `0`. Requires `textField`.

values.name: textIgnorePlacement
values.comment: If true, other symbols can be visible even if they collide with the text. Layout property. Defaults to `false`. Requires `textField`.

values.name: textJustify
values.comment: Text justification options. Layout property. Defaults to `textJustifyCenter`. Requires `textField`.

values.name: textKeepUpright
values.comment: If true, the text may be flipped vertically to prevent it from being rendered upside-down. Layout property. Defaults to `true`. Requires `textField`. Requires `textRotationAlignment` to be `map`. Requires `symbolPlacement` to be `symbolPlacementLine`, or `symbolPlacementLineCenter`.

values.name: textLetterSpacing
values.comment:
Text tracking amount. Layout property.
Units in ems. Defaults to `0`. Requires `textField`.

values.name: textLineHeight
values.comment:
Text leading value for multi-line text. Layout property.
Units in ems. Defaults to `1.2`. Requires `textField`.

values.name: textMaxAngle
values.comment:
Maximum angle change between adjacent characters. Layout property.
Units in degrees. Defaults to `45`. Requires `textField`. Requires `symbolPlacement` to be `symbolPlacementLine`, or `symbolPlacementLineCenter`.

values.name: textMaxWidth
values.comment:
The maximum line width for text wrapping. Layout property.

Should be greater than or equal to `0`.
Units in ems. Defaults to `10`. Requires `textField`.

values.name: textOffset
values.comment:
Offset distance of text from its anchor. Positive values indicate right and down, while negative values indicate left and up. Layout property.
Units in ems. Defaults to `0,0`. Requires `textField`.

values.name: textOpacity
values.comment:
The opacity at which the text will be drawn. Paint property.

Should be between `0` and `1` inclusive. Defaults to `1`. Requires `textField`.

values.name: textOptional
values.comment: If true, icons will display without their corresponding text when the text collides with other symbols and the icon does not. Layout property. Defaults to `false`. Requires `textField`. Requires `iconImage`.

values.name: textPadding
values.comment:
Size of the additional area around the text bounding box used for detecting symbol collisions. Layout property.

Should be greater than or equal to `0`.
Units in pixels. Defaults to `2`. Requires `textField`.

values.name: textPitchAlignment
values.comment:
Orientation of text when map is pitched. Layout property. Defaults to `anchorAuto`. Requires `textField`.

  - `anchorMap`: The text is aligned to the plane of the map.
  - `anchorViewport`: The text is aligned to the plane of the viewport.
  - `anchorAuto`: Automatically matches the value of `textRotationAlignment`.

values.name: textRotate
values.comment:
Rotates the text clockwise. Layout property.
Units in degrees. Defaults to `0`. Requires `textField`.

values.name: textRotationAlignment
values.comment:
In combination with `symbolPlacement`, determines the rotation behavior of the individual glyphs forming the text. Layout property. Defaults to `anchorAuto`. Requires `textField`.

  - `anchorMap`: When `symbolPlacement` is set to `symbolPlacementPoint`, aligns text east-west. When `symbolPlacement` is set to `symbolPlacementLine` or `symbolPlacementLineCenter`, aligns text x-axes with the line.
  - `anchorViewport`: Produces glyphs whose x-axes are aligned with the x-axis of the viewport, regardless of the value of `symbolPlacement`.
  - `anchorAuto`: When `symbolPlacement` is set to `symbolPlacementPoint`, this is equivalent to `anchorViewport`. When `symbolPlacement` is set to `symbolPlacementLine` or `symbolPlacementLineCenter`, this is equivalent to `anchorMap`.

values.name: textSize
values.comment:
Font size. Layout property.

Should be greater than or equal to `0`.
Units in pixels. Defaults to `16`. Requires `textField`.

values.name: textTransform
values.comment: Specifies how to capitalize text, similar to the CSS `textTransform` property. Layout property. Defaults to `textTransformNone`. Requires `textField`.

values.name: textTranslate
values.comment:
Distance that the text's anchor is moved from its original placement. Positive values indicate right and down, while negative values indicate left and up. Paint property.
Units in pixels. Defaults to `0,0`. Requires `textField`.

values.name: textTranslateAnchor
values.comment:
Controls the frame of reference for `textTranslate`. Paint property. Defaults to `anchorMap`. Requires `textField`. Requires `textTranslate`.

  - `anchorMap`: The text is translated relative to the map.
  - `anchorViewport`: The text is translated relative to the viewport.

values.name: visible
values.comment: Whether this layer is displayed.

name: Mapbox.Source

unions.name: GeoJSONSource
unions.comment: Marks attributes that are only applicable to GeoJSON sources

unions.name: RasterSource
unions.comment: Marks attributes that are only applicable to raster sources

unions.name: Scheme
unions.comment:
`XYZ`: Slippy map tilenames scheme.

`TMS`: OSGeo spec scheme.

unions.name: Source
unions.comment: Sources supply data to be shown on the map. Adding a source won't immediately make data appear on the map because sources don't contain styling details like color or width. Layers refer to a source and give it a visual representation. This makes it possible to style the same source in different ways, like differentiating between types of roads in a highways layer.

unions.name: SourceOption
unions.comment: Some sources can take options.

unions.name: VectorSource
unions.comment: Marks attributes that are only applicable to vector sources

aliases.name: Coords
aliases.comment: `(longitude, latitude)` pairs for the corners. You can use the type alias constructor in clockwise order: top left, top right, bottom right, bottom left.
aliases.type: { topLeft : LngLat.LngLat, topRight : LngLat.LngLat, bottomRight : LngLat.LngLat, bottomLeft : LngLat.LngLat }

aliases.name: Id
aliases.comment: Every layer is identified by an id.

aliases.name: Url
aliases.comment: Represents a URL. For tiles hosted by Mapbox, the "url" value should be of the form mapbox://mapid.

values.name: animatedCanvas
values.comment: A data source containing the contents of an HTML canvas. The second argument must be the DOM ID of the canvas element. This method is only appropriate with an animated Canvas (i.e. one that changes over time).

values.name: attribution
values.comment: Contains an attribution to be displayed when the map is shown to a user.

values.name: bounds
values.comment: The longitude and latitude of the southwest and northeast corners of the source's bounding box. When this property is included in a source, no tiles outside of the given bounds are requested by Mapbox GL.

values.name: buffer
values.comment: Size of the tile buffer on each side. A value of 0 produces no buffer. A value of 512 produces a buffer as wide as the tile itself. Larger values produce fewer rendering artifacts near tile edges and slower performance. Defaults to 128.

values.name: cluster
values.comment:
If the data is a collection of point features, setting this clusters the points by radius into groups.

Cluster groups become new Point features in the source with additional properties:

  - `cluster` Is `True` if the point is a cluster
  - `cluster_id` A unqiue id for the cluster.
  - `point_count` Number of original points grouped into this cluster
  - `point_count_abbreviated` An abbreviated point count

values.name: clusterRadius
values.comment: Radius of each cluster if clustering is enabled. A value of 512 indicates a radius equal to the width of a tile.

values.name: generateIds
values.comment: When set, the feature.id property will be auto assigned based on its index in the features array, over-writing any previous values.

values.name: geoJSONFromUrl
values.comment: A remote GeoJSON source.

values.name: geoJSONFromValue
values.comment: A GeoJSON source from some local data.

values.name: image
values.comment: An image source

values.name: lineMetrics
values.comment: Whether to calculate line distance metrics. This is required for line layers that specify `lineGradient` values.

values.name: maxzoom
values.comment: Maximum zoom level for which tiles are available, as in the TileJSON spec. Data from tiles at the maxzoom are used when displaying the map at higher zoom levels.

values.name: minzoom
values.comment: Minimum zoom level for which tiles are available, as in the TileJSON spec.

values.name: raster
values.comment: A raster tile source. Takes a list of one or more tile source URLs, as in the TileJSON spec.
values.type: Mapbox.Source.Id -> List.List Mapbox.Source.Url -> List.List (Mapbox.Source.SourceOption Mapbox.Source.RasterSource) -> Mapbox.Source.Source

values.name: rasterDEMMapbox
values.comment: The [Mapbox Terrain RGB](https://blog.mapbox.com/global-elevation-data-6689f1d0ba65) DEM source.

values.name: rasterDEMTerrarium
values.comment: A raster DEM source in the Terarrium format.

values.name: rasterFromUrl
values.comment: A raster tile source configured from a TileJSON spec.

values.name: scheme
values.comment: Influences the y direction of the tile coordinates. The global-mercator (aka Spherical Mercator) profile is assumed.

values.name: staticCanvas
values.comment: A data source containing the contents of an HTML canvas. The second argument must be the DOM ID of the canvas element. This method is only appropriate with a static Canvas (i.e. one that doesn't change), as it will be cached to improve performance.

values.name: tileSize
values.comment: The minimum visual size to display tiles for this layer.

values.name: tolerance
values.comment: Douglas-Peucker simplification tolerance (higher means simpler geometries and faster performance). Defaults to 0.375.

values.name: vector
values.comment:
A vector tile source. Tiles must be in [Mapbox Vector Tile format](https://www.mapbox.com/developers/vector-tiles/). All geometric coordinates in vector tiles must be between `-1 * extent` and `(extent * 2) - 1` inclusive. All layers that use a vector source must specify a `sourceLayer` value.

This takes an array of one or more tile source URLs, as in the TileJSON spec.
values.type: Mapbox.Source.Id -> List.List Mapbox.Source.Url -> List.List (Mapbox.Source.SourceOption Mapbox.Source.VectorSource) -> Mapbox.Source.Source

values.name: vectorFromUrl
values.comment:
A vector tile source. Tiles must be in [Mapbox Vector Tile format](https://www.mapbox.com/developers/vector-tiles/). All geometric coordinates in vector tiles must be between `-1 * extent` and `(extent * 2) - 1` inclusive. All layers that use a vector source must specify a `sourceLayer` value.

The first argument is the layers id, the second is a url to a [TileJSON specification](https://github.com/mapbox/tilejson-spec) that configures the source.

values.name: video
values.comment: A video source. For each URL in the list, a video element source will be created, in order to support same media in multiple formats supported by different browsers.

name: Mapbox.Style

unions.name: Style
unions.comment:
A mapbox style.

You can either create a style spec in Elm (for which the rest of this library is useful :) or load one from a remote URL.

To load a style from the Mapbox API, you can use a URL of the form `FromUrl "mapbox://styles/:owner/:style"`, where `:owner` is your Mapbox account name and `:style` is the style ID.

aliases.name: Light
aliases.comment:
The global light source.


### `anchor`

Whether extruded geometries are lit relative to the map or viewport.


### `position`

Position of the light source relative to lit (extruded) geometries, in `[r radial coordinate, a azimuthal angle, p polar angle]` where `r` indicates the distance from the center of the base of an object to its light, `a` indicates the position of the light relative to 0Â° (0Â° when the `anchor` is set to `anchorViewport` corresponds to the top of the viewport, or 0Â° when `anchor` is set to `anchorMap` corresponds to due north, and degrees proceed clockwise), and `p` indicates the height of the light (from 0Â°, directly above, to 180Â°, directly below).


### `color`

Color tint for lighting extruded geometries.


### `intensity`

Intensity of lighting (on a scale from 0 to 1). Higher numbers will present as more extreme contrast.
aliases.type: { anchor : Mapbox.Expression.Expression Mapbox.Expression.CameraExpression (Mapbox.Expression.Anchor Basics.Never), position : Mapbox.Expression.Expression Mapbox.Expression.CameraExpression (Array.Array Basics.Float), color : Mapbox.Expression.Expression Mapbox.Expression.CameraExpression Mapbox.Expression.Color, intensity : Mapbox.Expression.Expression Mapbox.Expression.CameraExpression Basics.Float }

aliases.name: StyleDef
aliases.comment:
This is the core representation of a Mapbox style. It has the following keys:


### Layers

These define what is actually rendered on screen. See the Mapbox.Layer module on how to configure these.


### Sources

These define the data sources that feed the Layers. See the Mapbox.Source module for more.


### Misc

These are all optional attributes.

All the other keys are values defined below.
aliases.type: { transition : Mapbox.Style.Transition, light : Mapbox.Style.Light, layers : List.List Mapbox.Layer.Layer, sources : List.List Mapbox.Source.Source, misc : List.List Mapbox.Style.MiscAttr }

aliases.name: Transition
aliases.comment:
A transition property controls timing for the interpolation between a transitionable style property's previous value and new value.


### `duration`

Time (in ms) allotted for transitions to complete.


### `delay`

Length of time (in ms) before a transition begins.

values.name: defaultBearing
values.comment: Default bearing, in degrees. The bearing is the compass direction that is "up"; for example, a bearing of 90Â° orients the map so that east is up. This value will be used only if the map has not been positioned by other means (e.g. map options or user interaction).

values.name: defaultCenter
values.comment: Default map center in longitude and latitude. The style center will be used only if the map has not been positioned by other means (e.g. map options or user interaction).

values.name: defaultLight
values.comment: A decent default light.

values.name: defaultPitch
values.comment: Default pitch, in degrees. Zero is perpendicular to the surface, for a look straight down at the map, while a greater value like 60 looks ahead towards the horizon. The style pitch will be used only if the map has not been positioned by other means (e.g. map options or user interaction).

values.name: defaultTransition
values.comment: The defaults for a transition

values.name: defaultZoomLevel
values.comment: Default zoom level. The style zoom will be used only if the map has not been positioned by other means (e.g. map options or user interaction).

values.name: encode
values.comment: Encodes the style into JSON.

values.name: glyphs
values.comment: A URL template for loading signed-distance-field glyph sets in PBF format. The URL must include `{fontstack}` and `{range}` tokens. This property is required if any layer uses the `textField` layout property.

values.name: metadata
values.comment: Arbitrary properties useful to track with the stylesheet, but do not influence rendering. Properties should be prefixed to avoid collisions, like 'mapbox:'.

values.name: name
values.comment: A human-readable name for the style.

values.name: sprite
values.comment: A base URL for retrieving the sprite image and metadata. The extensions .png, .json and scale factor @2x.png will be automatically appended. This property is required if any layer uses the `backgroundPattern`, `fillPattern`, `linePattern`, `fillExtrusionPattern`, or `iconImage` properties.
